aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The defining event was a ground collision during taxi-to-runway.
The pilot was a 28-year-old male.
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot had a Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot had no instrument rating.
The pilot had no instructor rating.
The pilot occupied the left seat.
The pilot used a 3-point restraint.
The pilot did not have a second pilot present.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot had a Class 1 medical certification without waivers or limitations.
The pilot's last FAA medical exam was on September 17, 2015.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on November 19, 2019.
The pilot had 104.3 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 28 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot had 43.2 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 36.9 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 20.7 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot-rated passenger was a 27-year-old female.
The pilot-rated passenger held a Private certificate.
The pilot-rated passenger had a Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot-rated passenger had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot-rated passenger had no instrument rating.
The pilot-rated passenger had no instructor rating.
The pilot-rated passenger occupied the right seat.
The pilot-rated passenger used a 3-point restraint.
The pilot-rated passenger had a second pilot present.
The pilot-rated passenger was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot-rated passenger had a Class 1 medical certification with waivers or limitations.
The pilot-rated passenger's last FAA medical exam was on March 20, 2018.
The pilot-rated passenger had 213.1 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot-rated passenger had 93.6 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot-rated passenger had 108.1 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot-rated passenger had 70.9 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot-rated passenger had 26.6 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The pilot-rated passenger had 2 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
Taxi-to runway | Ground collision (Defining event)

## Pilot Information
Certificate: | Private
Age: | 28,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 3-point
Instrument Rating(s): | None
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 1 Without waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | September 17, 2015
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | November 19, 2019
Flight Time: | 104.3 hours (Total, all aircraft), 28 hours (Total, this make and model), 43.2 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 36.9 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 20.7 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft)

## Pilot-rated passenger Information
Certificate: | Private
Age: | 27,Female
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Right
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: | 3-point
Instrument Rating(s): | None
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 1 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | March 20, 2018
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: |
Flight Time: | 213.1 hours (Total, all aircraft), 93.6 hours (Total, this make and model), 108.1 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 70.9 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 26.6 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 2 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)
